results.title: Your clothing can burn
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct as well as incorrect procedures for dealing with clothing whenit is ignited. Uses laboratory experiments to show the importance of selecting clothing and fabrics that resist fire.

results.title: Your choice
results.brief_description: Raoul, an alligator, has a bad tooth and also needs a hair cut. Is he going to the barber or to the dentist, or neither of them? Madillo, an armadillo, wonders if he should bring an umbrella or not. So, what is your choice?

results.title: Your children walking
results.creator_credit: Alex Strasser, Brian Smith and Realist Films
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of adopting good foot habits and wearing suitable shoes and socks in childhood to develop strong, healthy feet. Studies the physiology of the foot.

results.title: Your children and you
results.creator_credit: Brian Smith and British Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Child care in the first years of life. Many hints on the correct care of infants and young children are given, from the weaning of the infant to the prevention of unnecessary fears, boredom, bad temper and maladjustment.

results.title: Your children's sleep
results.creator_credit: Jane Massy, Brian Smith and Realist Films
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is why children can’t sleep, what sleep does for children, and why it is much more important for them than it is for adults. Insignificant to the adult, the problems of childhood are real and frightening to children. Because sleep is for children a vital continuation of waking life, during which their minds have a tremendous amount of sorting out to do, some of their problems may cause restlessness and nightmares. Parents can help their children to get sound, healthy sleep by giving them a sense of security and well-being.

results.title: Your children's ears
results.creator_credit: Albert Pearl, Margaret Thomson, Realist Films and C O I
results.brief_description: This film opens with a sequence showing children in school; these children are all deaf, some from birth, but the majority of them as a result of common aliments like measles, influenza, tonsillitis, and other ear-nose-and-throat diseases which, if not properly cared for, can cause total or partial deafness. A very clear explanation of the structure of the ear and the care which should be taken of everyday complaints, is given.
